intro: Astrephia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican star flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or dry environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Astrephia mexicana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
